Class Utility

java.lang.Object
  uw.rfpk.mda.nonmem.Utility

public class Utility
extends java.lang.Object

This class defines static functions used by steps.

find

public static int find(java.lang.String input,
                       java.lang.String s)
Find substrings that has the patten of s(i), where s is a character string i is an integer number. Than find the largest i among all the substrings.

Parameters:
input - a String object containing the text to search in.
s - a String object containing the character string described above.
Returns:
an int, the largest number found as described above.

parseDataXML

public static java.lang.String[] parseDataXML(java.lang.String dataXML,
                                              java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector> data)
Parse the data XML document and put the data in a Vector object.

Parameters:
dataXML - the data in XML format.
data - a Vector in which each contained object is also a Vector that contains the data of one individual. The individual data vector contains String arrays. The number of arrays is the number of the data records for the individual. Each array contains data items of number of columns.
Returns:
an int value that is the number of data columns in the data file. In caes of error, -1 is returned.

parseDataFile

public static java.lang.String[] parseDataFile(java.lang.String filename,
                                               java.util.Vector<java.util.Vector> data,
                                               boolean isInd)
Parse the data file and put the data in a Vector object.

Parameters:
filename - a String object containing the data file name.
data - a Vector in which each contained object is also a Vector that contains the data of one individual. The individual data vector contains String arrays. The number of arrays is the number of the data records for the individual. Each array contains data items of number of columns.
isInd - a boolean true for individual analysis, false for population analysis.
Returns:
a String array containing the data labels in the comment line. In case of error, null is returned.

Returns:

removeMissingValue

public static double[] removeMissingValue(double[] data)
Remove missing values in a data array.

Parameters:
data - a data array of double values.
Returns:
the resulted data array or null if there is no data in the original array.

removeMissingValue

public static double[][] removeMissingValue(double[] dataX,
                                            double[] dataY,
                                            int start,
                                            int end)
Remove missing values in two data array. If a data element is missing in one array, the data element in the other array is also removed. The data element before the specified starting index and after the specified ending index are also removed.

Parameters:
dataX - a data array of double values.
dataY - a data array of double values.
start - starting index to pick data.
end - ending index to pick data.
Returns:
the two resulted data arrays or null if there is no data in the original arrays. The two returned arrays are bundled in an array: first for dataX, last for dataY.

Parameters:
args - argument not used.
